question: What is the mode of action of Tetrocarcin-A?
ideal_answer: The anti-tumor antibiotic, tetrocarcin A, directly induces apoptosis of human breast cancer cells.

snippets.text: Tetrocarcin A (TC-A) and bcl-2 antisense oligonucleotides exhibit antitumor activity by inhibiting Bcl-2 function and transcription, respectively
Apoptosis and inactivation of the PI3-kinase pathway by tetrocarcin A in breast cancers
Here we find that an anti-tumor antibiotic, tetrocarcin A, directly induces apoptosis of human breast cancer cells.

Tetrocarcin-A (TC-A), an antibiotic agent isolated from actinomycetes, has recently been described to antagonize Bcl-2 functions, thereby sensitizing tumor cells to cell death signals under control of Bcl-2.
Natural compound Tetrocarcin-A downregulates Junctional Adhesion Molecule-A in conjunction with HER2 and inhibitor of apoptosis proteins and inhibits tumor cell growth.
